instructions: Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 1 1 Open Settings. It's a gray app with gears ( ) that's typically located on your home screen. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 2 2 Tap your Apple ID. It's the section at the top of the menu that contains your name and image if you've added one. If you are not signed in, tap Sign in to your iPhone , enter your Apple ID and password, then tap Sign In . If you are running an older version of iOS, you may not need to do this step. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 3 3 Tap . It's in the second section of the menu. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 4 4 Scroll down and tap . It's at the bottom of the "APPS USING ICLOUD" section. Slide iCloud Backup to the "On" (green) position, if it's not already. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 5 5 Tap . It's at the bottom of the screen. Wait until the backup is complete. You must be connected to a Wi-Fi network to back up your iPhone. Advertisement

Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 6 1 Open Settings. It's a gray app that contains an image of gears ( ) and is typically located on your home screen. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 7 2 Scroll down and tap . It's near the top of the menu, next to a gear ( ) icon. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 8 3 Scroll down and tap . It's at the bottom of the menu. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 9 4 Tap . It's near the top of the menu. Erasing your iPhone is a good option if you are planning on getting rid of your phone and don't want someone else accessing your information. However, if you simply want to restore default settings without deleting any data or media, tap Reset All Settings . Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 10 5 Enter your passcode. Enter the passcode you use to unlock your phone. If prompted, enter your "Restrictions" passcode. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 11 6 Tap . Doing so will reset all settings, as well as erase the media and data on your iPhone. If you haven't backed up your iPhone to iCloud, you will permanently lose all the data and media on it. Your phone will show Swipe to set up after it's done deleting your content, as it did when it was first purchased. You can also restore your phone by putting it in recovery mode and connecting it to a computer using iTunes. This method guarantees you are installing the latest software version from Apple. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 12 1 Open Find My iPhone on another device. Do so by launching the app on a mobile device or going to iCloud in a web browser . The "Find My iPhone" feature must be enabled on your iPhone and the device must be powered on and connected to the Internet in order to perform a remote reset. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 13 2 Sign in with your Apple ID. Use the Apple ID and password with which you signed into your iPhone. If the app is on a device that belongs to another person, you may need to tap Sign Out in the upper-right corner of the app screen in order to sign in with your own Apple ID. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 14 3 Tap your iPhone. It should appear in a list of devices below the map; it's location will be displayed on the map, which will zoom in when you select your iPhone. If the phone has been powered off, or the battery has died, it will show you the last known location of your phone, but will not be able to show you the current address. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 15 4 Tap . It's at the bottom-center of the screen. Image titled Erase or Wipe an iPhone Step 16 5 Tap . It's in the lower-right corner of the screen. This action erases all the data on your iPhone, which also means that you'll no longer be able to use Find My iPhone to locate your device. Regularly back up your iPhone to iCloud or iTunes in case you ever need to restore erased data. Advertisement
